qas.question: How many days can the Daysimeter gather for analysis?
What type of light stimulates the circadian system?

context: The small, head-mounted device measures an individual's daily rest and activity patterns, as well as exposure to <a1_0>short-wavelength light<a1_0/> that stimulates the circadian system. The device measures activity and light together at regular time intervals and electronically stores and logs its operating temperature. The Daysimeter can gather data for up to <a0_0>30<a0_0/> days for analysis.
